results.title: Alice, sweet Alice = Holy terror = Communion
results.brief_description: Alice is quite unlike other girls her age. Instead of playing with friends, she loses herself in a distorted secret world, populated by satanic rituals and occult masks. Alice is fiercely jealous of the favouritism her parents show towards her younger sister, Karen, a sibling jealousy that verges on demonic. When Alice’s sister and aunt are mysteriously murdered, Alice’s parents question the depths of their daughter’s evil intent. As the family self destructs, a priest and the police believe there are stronger forces involved and are intent on uncovering the unholy truth embodied in a seemingly normal Alice. Brooke Shields makes a brief, 10 minute appearance. Cast includes Linda Miller, Mildred Clinton, Paula Shepherd and Niles McMaster.

results.title: Alice Springs: red heart blue centre
results.creator_credit: James Coffey, Frank Bagnall, Department of the Northern Territory and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Alice Springs is viewed here in its natural environment of desert landscape, ringed by distant ranges and Ayers Rock and as a busy township with its regular services, activities and recreations. From varied shots of its people and activities the camera frequently returns to the countryside around and shows close-up shots of its plant life. No spoken commentary.

results.title: Alice in wonderland
results.creator_credit: Nick Willing, Dyson Lovell, Babelsberg International Film Produktion and Hallmark Entertainment
results.brief_description: After running away from home, Alice steps into a rabbit hole and enters an incredible magical world full of adventure. Originally produced for television, this adaptation of the Lewis Carroll classic features an impressive cast and special effects from Frame Store and Jim Henson’s Creature Shop. Cast includes Robbie Coltrane, Whoopi Goldberg, Ben Kingsley, Christopher Lloyd, Martin Short and many more.

results.title: Alice in the cities = Alice in den Stadten
results.creator_credit: Wim Wenders, Joachim von Mengershausen and Filmverlag der Autoren
results.brief_description: Through the story of a disillusioned young photojournalist who, returning from a fruitless assignment in the States, unwittingly becomes involved in a little girl’s search for her family in the North German industrial heartland, Wenders forges a distinctly European variation on the road movie. Few films capture so evocatively the feeling of life in the 20th century technological jungle, but for all its vistas of alienation and Americanisation, “Alice in the cities” finally resolves itself into a touching, indeed moving, affirmation of human relationships in an otherwise bleak world. Cast includes Rudiger Vogler and Yella Rottlander, with a haunting musical score by Can.

results.title: Alice doesn't live here anymore
results.creator_credit: Martin Scorsese, Audrey Maas, David Susskind and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: In her remarkable Academy Award winning portrayal, Ellen Burstyn stars as Alice, a recently widowed housewife who packs herself and her son into a station wagon and heads off in search of a better life. Alice travels a bumpy road - no money, nowhere jobs and not much luck. She fights back with a spirited determination, which underscores this moving, often funny tale of one woman’s struggle for self-awareness and independence. With ‘Alice Doesn’t Live Here Anymore’, director Martin Scorsese shows that he is equally at home in semi-rural surroundings as he is in the asphalt jungle of ‘Taxi Driver’. The outstanding supporting cast includes Kris Kristofferson, Jodie Foster and Harvey Keitel.

results.title: Ali: the legend
results.brief_description: Documentary on boxing and sports legend Muhammad Ali, born Cassius Clay. Ali became a symbol of African American pride during, and after, his dominance of the sport during the 1960s and 70s. This work contains actual footage of events in Ali’s life - mostly extensive clips from lengthy bouts, including fights with George Foreman, several with Joe Frazier and numerous other boxers, many of whom Ali defeated. Also features clips of Ali in training; at press conferences; and relaxing and playing with his daughter. Includes some brief archival interviews (some audio only) with Ali and news footage from 1967 when Ali caused a furore by refusing to serve in the armed forces in Vietnam, due to his religion of Islam. At press conferences throughout his career Ali proved that he often cut an amusing, charismatic and inspirational figure.

results.title: Ali Baba
results.brief_description: An animated film presenting the tale of the little boy and the forty thieves with charmingly designed and coloured figures. Ali Baba’s discovery of the hidden treasure, how he keeps Mustafa and the thieves from recapturing it, and the lad’s generosity as he distributes the jewels among the townspeople is told with brief rhymed narration to the accompaniment of wind music. No other credits available.

results.title: Ali
results.creator_credit: Michael Mann, James Lassiter, Jon Peters, A. Kitman Ho, Paul Ardaji and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Michael Mann’s sprawling bio pic tries to cover big ground with this iconoclastic boxing figure. The results are more like a greatest hits as Mann tracks Ali’s rise in the boxing world and his status as a potent force in black politics. Will Smith inhabits the towering frame of Ali quite convincingly, turning in a performance which is more like a collage of Ali sound bytes. Along the way we become privy to some of the most influential and turbulent political movements in America; through Ali’s controversial association with activist Malcolm X, his conversion to Islam and his uncompromising anti-Vietnam war stance. While less savory aspects of Ali’s life (like his notorious womanizing) are left pretty much alone. Ali also draws on the mythical boxing match ‘Rumble in the jungle’ which was also the subject of the compelling documentary ‘When we were kings’. Cast includes: Jada Pinkett Smith, Jamie Foxx, Ron Silver, Jon Voight, Mario Van Peebles, Jeffrey Wright.

results.title: Algerian pipeline
results.creator_credit: Derek Williams, Humphrey Swingler, Greenpark Productions and British Information Services
results.brief_description: The ever-increasing output of Algeria’s oilfields demanded a new pipeline outlet to the Mediterranean. The sponsors were awarded a 25 million pound contract to design and construct a complete pipeline installation within the short time of 18 months. This film describes how a 500-mile pipeline was constructed from the Sahara across the Atlas Mountains to Arzew. The building of pump stations, departure and arrival terminals, submarine loading lines, ancillary works and the training of Algerian personnel are also covered.

results.title: An Egyptian story = Hadota Misreya [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Youssef Chahine and Misr International Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Alexandria Trilogy”.
This unusual and fascinating follow-up to “Alexandria, why?” picks up the story of Yehia, the troubled adolescent boy headed for prosperity in America as WWII ravaged his Egyptian homeland. Yehia, now a draconian film director who neglects his wife and children in order to create his work, falls ill and requires open-heart surgery. During the operation a young boy, representing Yehia’s conscience, accuses him of betraying his ideals. A metamorphic trial ensues in which various witnesses, including family and colleagues, offer their testimony about “the defendant”. These proceedings force the filmmaker to come to terms with hidden emotions involving his life, work and country. Chahine’s work examines the politics of the 1952 revolution and its demise in 1967, as well as the frissons that arise as he tries to reconcile his art with his ambitions. This film recalls “Eight and a half” and “All that jazz” in that it examines one man’s conscience and history, in a humoristic, satirical and at times, surrealistic, manner. This sequel was followed up by “Alexandria again and forever”. In Arabic with English subtitles.
